critique: This document is an executive order creating the Electric Home and Farm Authority, Inc. (EHFFA) as part of the New Deal. It aims to promote industrial organization, increase consumption, reduce unemployment, and improve labor standards, aligning with the National Industrial Recovery Act. The order establishes the corporation, defines its structure, and allocates funds. It centralizes control under the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) directors and grants broad authority to the board, bypassing civil service laws. Ideologically, it leans liberal due to its interventionist approach to the economy and focus on social welfare. Immigration is not addressed, so it's neutral. Executive power is expanded as the President authorizes the creation of the corporation and delegates authority. Federalism is strengthened as the federal government creates and controls the corporation. National security vs. civil liberties is not directly addressed, so it's neutral. Economic regulation is heavily emphasized through government intervention. Social inclusion is not directly addressed, so it's neutral.
